availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Samuel J. Vaughn (Estill County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Estill County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married Polly Vaughn. Father of Sarah F. Vaughn, John W. Vaughn, Phebe Vaughn, Joshua Vaughn, and July Vaughn. Farmer in Estill County in 1850 and 1860. Owned six enslaved persons in 1850 and 1860.

bibl.p: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Estill County, p. 58. Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Estill County. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Estill County, p. 76. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Estill County, p. 9. Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Estill County, Millers Creek, p. 29. Find A Grave, "Samuel Jackson Vaughn (1807-1884)," Memorial #5514049, http://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=5514049 (accessed April 23, 2017).
